bibl.title: Ptolemaic Alexandria and the Egyptian Tradition.

series.title: Centre for Hellenic Studies. King's College London. Publications.

bibl.note: Explores the possibility that the Pharaonic-style sculptural material from pre-Ptolemaic times to the late first century B.C. reflects the presence of an Egyptian population established in Alexandria.
bibl.seg: ASHTON Sally-Ann, Ptolemaic Alexandria and the Egyptian Tradition.
Anthony HIRST and Michael SILK (Edd.), Alexandria, Real and Imagined = Centre for Hellenic Studies. King's College London. Publications. 5 (Aldershot, 2004) pp. 15-40, 7 figg.

Explores the possibility that the Pharaonic-style sculptural material from pre-Ptolemaic times to the late first century B.C. reflects the presence of an Egyptian population established in Alexandria.
